OrgTokenId.description: System generated unique identifier for an organization token.

OrgTokenName.description: Readable name for a token. Must be unique within an organization.

createdBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that created the token.

OrgId.description: System generated unique identifier for an organization. Not guaranteed to have a specific format.

RoomId.description:
Unique identifier to a game session or match. Use the default system generated ID or overwrite it with your own.
Note: error will be returned if `roomId` is not globally unique.

AppId.description: System generated unique identifier for an application.

RoomConfig.description: Optional configuration parameters for the room. Can be any string including stringified JSON. It is accessible from the room via [`GetRoomInfo()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/RoomV2/operation/GetRoomInfo).

RoomAllocationId.description: System generated unique identifier to an allocated instance of a room.

ProcessId.description: System generated unique identifier to a runtime instance of your game server.

RoomAllocation.description: Metadata on an allocated instance of a room.

RoomStatus.description:
The allocation status of a room.

`scheduling`: a process is not allocated yet and the room is waiting to be scheduled

`active`: ready to accept connections

`destroyed`: all associated metadata is deleted

Room.description: A room object represents a game session or match.

TransportType.description: Transport type specifies the underlying communication protocol to the exposed port.

ConnectionInfo.description: Connection information to the default port.

ExposedPort.description: Connection details for an active process.

status.description: `exposedPort` will only be available when the `status` of a room is "active".

ConnectionInfoV2.description: Connection information for the default and additional ports.

DeploymentId.description: System generated id for a deployment. Increments by 1.

NumRoomsPerProcess.description: Governs how many [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) can be scheduled in a process.

egressedBytes.description: Measures network traffic leaving the process in bytes.

activeConnections.description: Tracks the number of active connections to a process.

roomsAllocated.description: Tracks the number of rooms that have been allocated to the process.

draining.description: Process in drain will not accept any new rooms.

terminatedAt.description: When the process has been terminated.

stoppingAt.description: When the process is issued to stop. We use this to determine when we should stop billing.

startedAt.description: When the process bound to the specified port. We use this to determine when we should start billing.

startingAt.description: When the process started being provisioned.

Process.description: A process object represents a runtime instance of your game server and its metadata.

status.description: Process in drain will not accept any new rooms.

roomsAllocated.description: Tracks the number of rooms that have been allocated to the process.

terminatedAt.description: When the process has been terminated.

stoppingAt.description: When the process is issued to stop. We use this to determine when we should stop billing.

startedAt.description: When the process bound to the specified port. We use this to determine when we should start billing.

createdAt.description: When the process started being provisioned.

GlobalDeploymentId.description: System generated id for a deployment.

status.description: Process in drain will not accept any new rooms.

roomsAllocated.description: Tracks the number of rooms that have been allocated to the process.

terminatedAt.description: When the process has been terminated.

stoppingAt.description: When the process is issued to stop. We use this to determine when we should stop billing.

startedAt.description: When the process bound to the specified port. We use this to determine when we should start billing.

createdAt.description: When the process started being provisioned.

MetricName.description: Available metrics to query over time.

MetricsStep.description: Width of time in seconds to group data.

UserId.description: System generated unique identifier for a user. Not guaranteed to have a specific format.

TailLines.description: Number of lines to return from most recent logs history.

LobbyVisibility.description:
Types of lobbies a player can create.

`private`: the player who created the room must share the roomId with their friends

`public`: visible in the public lobby list, anyone can join

`local`: for testing with a server running locally

LobbyInitialConfig.description: User input to initialize the game state. Object must be smaller than 64KB.

state.description: JSON blob to store metadata for a room. Must be smaller than 1MB.

createdBy.description: UserId or email address for the user that created the lobby.

Lobby.description: A lobby object allows you to store and manage metadata for your rooms.

state.description: JSON blob to store metadata for a room. Must be smaller than 1MB.

shortCode.description: User defined identifier for a lobby, defaults to `roomId`

createdBy.description: UserId or email address for the user that created the lobby.

roomId.description: Hathora generated identifier for a room, unique for a given application (including stopped rooms)

LobbyV3.description: A lobby object allows you to store and manage metadata for your rooms.

BuildId.description: System generated id for a build. Increments by 1.

ContainerPort.description: A container port object represents the transport configruations for how your server will listen.

PlanName.description:
A plan defines how much CPU and memory is required to run an instance of your game server.

`tiny`: shared core, 1gb memory

`small`: 1 core, 2gb memory

`medium`: 2 core, 4gb memory

`large`: 4 core, 8gb memory

idleTimeoutEnabled.description:
Option to shut down processes that have had no new connections or rooms
for five minutes.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

defaultContainerPort.description: Describes the primary port your process listens on.

createdBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that created the deployment.

requestedMemoryMB.description: The amount of memory allocated to your process.

requestedCPU.description: The number of cores allocated to your process.

DeploymentV1.description: Deployment is a versioned configuration for a build that describes runtime behavior.

idleTimeoutEnabled.description:
Option to shut down processes that have had no new connections or rooms
for five minutes.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

containerPort.description: Default port the server listens on.

DeploymentConfig.description: User specified deployment configuration for your application at runtime.

idleTimeoutEnabled.description:
Option to shut down processes that have had no new connections or rooms
for five minutes.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

defaultContainerPort.description: Describes the primary port your process listens on.

createdBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that created the deployment.

requestedMemoryMB.description: The amount of memory allocated to your process.

requestedCPU.description: The number of cores allocated to your process.

idleTimeoutEnabled.description:
Option to shut down processes that have had no new connections or rooms
for five minutes.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

containerPort.description: Default port the server listens on.

requestedMemoryMB.description: The amount of memory allocated to your process.

requestedCPU.description: The number of cores allocated to your process.

GlobalBuildId.description: System generated id for a build. Can also be user defined when creating a build.

BuildTag.description: Tag to associate an external version with a build. It is accessible via [`GetBuildInfo()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV2/operation/GetBuildInfo).

idleTimeoutEnabled.description:
Option to shut down processes that have had no new connections or rooms
for five minutes.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

defaultContainerPort.description: Describes the primary port your process listens on.

createdBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that created the deployment.

requestedMemoryMB.description: The amount of memory allocated to your process.

requestedCPU.description: The number of cores allocated to your process.

idleTimeoutEnabled.description:
Option to shut down processes that have had no new connections or rooms
for five minutes.

env.description: The environment variable that our process will have access to at runtime.

additionalContainerPorts.description: Additional ports your server listens on.

containerPort.description: Default port the server listens on.

requestedMemoryMB.description: The amount of memory allocated to your process.

requestedCPU.description: The number of cores allocated to your process.

imageSize.description: The size (in bytes) of the Docker image built by Hathora.

status.description:
Current status of your build.

`created`: a build was created but not yet run

`running`: the build process is actively executing

`succeeded`: the game server artifact was successfully built and stored in the Hathora registries

`failed`: the build process was unsuccessful, most likely due to an error with the `Dockerfile`

createdBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that created the build.

Build.description: A build represents a game server artifact and its associated metadata.

buildId.description: Optionally a value to replace the default buildId. This must be unique to the organization.

imageSize.description: The size (in bytes) of the Docker image built by Hathora.

status.description:
Current status of your build.

`created`: a build was created but not yet run

`running`: the build process is actively executing

`succeeded`: the game server artifact was successfully built and stored in the Hathora registries

`failed`: the build process was unsuccessful, most likely due to an error with the `Dockerfile`

createdBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that created the build.

BuildV3.description: A build represents a game server artifact and its associated metadata.

Record_string.never_.description: Construct a type with a set of properties K of type T

Partial__card-CardPaymentMethod--ach-Ach.description: Make all properties in T optional

token.description: A unique Hathora-signed JWT player token.

nickname.description: An alias to represent a player.

idToken.description: A Google-signed OIDC ID token representing a player's authenticated identity. Learn how to get an `idToken` [here](https://cloud.google.com/docs/authentication/get-id-token).

AppName.description: Readable name for an application. Must be unique within an organization.

AppSecret.description: Secret that is used for identity and access management.

clientId.description: A Google generated token representing the developer's credentials for [Google's API Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/dashboard?pli=1&project=discourse-login-388921). Learn how to get a `clientId` [here](https://developers.google.com/identity/gsi/web/guides/get-google-api-clientid).

google.description: Enable google auth for your application.

nickname.description: Enable nickname auth for your application.

anonymous.description: Enable anonymous auth for your application.

AuthConfiguration.description: Configure [player authentication](https://hathora.dev/docs/lobbies-and-matchmaking/auth-service) for your application. Use Hathora's built-in auth providers or use your own [custom authentication](https://hathora.dev/docs/lobbies-and-matchmaking/auth-service#custom-auth-provider).

deletedBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that deleted the application.

createdBy.description: The email address or token id for the user that created the application.

authConfiguration.description: Used to authenticate player requests. Use your own authentication or Hathora's Auth Client.

Application.description: An application object is the top level namespace for the game server.

info.title: Hathora Cloud API
info.description: Welcome to the Hathora Cloud API documentation! Learn how to use the Hathora Cloud APIs to build and scale your game servers globally.

get.description: List all organization tokens for a given org.

post.description: Create a new organization token.
Revoke an organization token.

Create a new [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Poll the [`GetConnectionInfo()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/RoomV2/operation/GetConnectionInfo) endpoint to get connection details for an active room.

get.description: Retreive current and historical allocation data for a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room).
Get all active [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) for a given [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process).
Get all inactive [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) for a given [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process).

post.description: Destroy a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room). All associated metadata is deleted.
Suspend a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room). The room is unallocated from the process but can be rescheduled later using the same `roomId`.

get.description: Poll this endpoint to get connection details to a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room). Clients can call this endpoint without authentication.

Retrieve 10 most recently started [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter the array by optionally passing in a `region`.

Retrieve 10 most recently stopped [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter the array by optionally passing in a `region`.
Get details for a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process).
Get details for a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process).

Retrieve the 10 most recent [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter the array by optionally passing in a `status` or `region`.

Count the number of [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter by optionally passing in a `status` or `region`.

post.description: Stops a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) immediately.

Creates a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) without a room. Use this to pre-allocate processes ahead of time so that subsequent room assignment via [CreateRoom()](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/RoomV2/operation/CreateRoom) can be instant.

get.description: Retrieve the 10 most recent [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter the array by optionally passing in a `status` or `region`.

Count the number of [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) objects for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter by optionally passing in a `status` or `region`.

post.description: Creates a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) without a room. Use this to pre-allocate processes ahead of time so that subsequent room assignment via [CreateRoom()](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/RoomV2/operation/CreateRoom) can be instant.

get.description: Get details for a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process).

post.description: Stops a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) immediately.

get.description: Returns an unsorted list of all organizations that you are a member of (an accepted membership invite). An organization is uniquely identified by an `orgId`.
Get metrics for a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) using `appId` and `processId`.

parameters.description: Available metrics to query over time.
parameters.name: metrics

parameters.description: Unix timestamp. Default is current time.
parameters.name: end

parameters.description: Unix timestamp. Default is -1 hour from `end`.
parameters.name: start

get.description: Returns a stream of logs for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.
Returns a stream of logs for a [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process) using `appId` and `processId`.
Download entire log file for a stopped process.
Returns a stream of logs for a [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) using `appId` and `deploymentId`.

post.description: Create a new lobby for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). A lobby object is a wrapper around a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) object. With a lobby, you get additional functionality like configuring the visibility of the room, managing the state of a match, and retrieving a list of public lobbies to display to players.

get.description: Get all active lobbies for a an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter by optionally passing in a `region`. Use this endpoint to display all public lobbies that a player can join in the game client.

parameters.description: Region to filter by. If omitted, active public lobbies in all regions will be returned.
parameters.name: region

get.description: Get details for a lobby.

post.description: Set the state of a lobby. State is intended to be set by the server and must be smaller than 1MB. Use this endpoint to store match data like live player count to enforce max number of clients or persist end-game data (i.e. winner or final scores).

Create a new lobby for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). A lobby object is a wrapper around a [room](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room) object. With a lobby, you get additional functionality like configuring the visibility of the room, managing the state of a match, and retrieving a list of public lobbies to display to players.

get.description: Get all active lobbies for a given [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). Filter the array by optionally passing in a `region`. Use this endpoint to display all public lobbies that a player can join in the game client.

parameters.description: If omitted, active public lobbies in all regions will be returned.
parameters.name: region

get.description: Get details for a lobby.
Get details for a lobby. If 2 or more lobbies have the same `shortCode`, then the most recently created lobby will be returned.

Returns an array of V1 regions with a host and port that a client can directly ping. Open a websocket connection to `wss://<host>:<port>/ws` and send a packet. To calculate ping, measure the time it takes to get an echo packet back.

Returns an array of all regions with a host and port that a client can directly ping. Open a websocket connection to `wss://<host>:<port>/ws` and send a packet. To calculate ping, measure the time it takes to get an echo packet back.
Returns an array of [deployments](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Get the latest [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Get details for a [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment).

post.description: Create a new [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment). Creating a new deployment means all new rooms created will use the latest deployment configuration, but existing games in progress will not be affected.

get.description: Returns an array of [deployments](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Get the latest [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Get details for a [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment).

post.description: Create a new [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment). Creating a new deployment means all new rooms created will use the latest deployment configuration, but existing games in progress will not be affected.

get.description: Returns an array of [deployments](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).

post.description: Create a new [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment). Creating a new deployment means all new rooms created will use the latest deployment configuration, but existing games in progress will not be affected.

get.description: Get the latest [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Get details for a [deployment](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment).
Returns an array of [builds](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Get details for a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build).

post.description: Creates a new [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build). Responds with a `buildId` that you must pass to [`RunBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/RunBuild) to build the game server artifact. You can optionally pass in a `buildTag` to associate an external version with a build.

delete.description: Delete a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build). All associated metadata is deleted.

get.description: Returns an array of [builds](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Get details for a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build).

post.description: Creates a new [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build). Responds with a `buildId` that you must pass to [`RunBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/RunBuild) to build the game server artifact. You can optionally pass in a `buildTag` to associate an external version with a build.

Creates a new [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) with `uploadUrl` that can be used to upload the build to before calling `runBuild`. Responds with a `buildId` that you must pass to [`RunBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/RunBuild) to build the game server artifact. You can optionally pass in a `buildTag` to associate an external version with a build.

Creates a new [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) with optional `multipartUploadUrls` that can be used to upload larger builds in parts before calling `runBuild`. Responds with a `buildId` that you must pass to [`RunBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/RunBuild) to build the game server artifact. You can optionally pass in a `buildTag` to associate an external version with a build.

delete.description: Delete a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build). All associated metadata is deleted.

get.description: Returns an array of [builds](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).

post.description: Creates a new [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) with optional `multipartUploadUrls` that can be used to upload larger builds in parts before calling `runBuild`. Responds with a `buildId` that you must pass to [`RunBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/RunBuild) to build the game server artifact. You can optionally pass in a `buildTag` to associate an external version with a build.

get.description: Get details for a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build).

delete.description:
Delete a [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build). All associated metadata is deleted.
Be careful which builds you delete. This endpoint does not prevent you from deleting actively used builds.
Deleting a build that is actively build used by an app's deployment will cause failures when creating rooms.

post.description: Builds a game server artifact from a tarball you provide. Pass in the `buildId` generated from [`CreateBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/CreateBuild).
Returns a unique player token for an anonymous user.
Returns a unique player token with a specified nickname for a user.
Returns a unique player token using a Google-signed OIDC `idToken`.

get.description: Returns an unsorted list of your organizations [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). An application is uniquely identified by an `appId`.

post.description: Create a new [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Update data for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.

get.description: Get details for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.

delete.description: Delete an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. Your organization will lose access to this application.

get.description: Returns an unsorted list of your organizations [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application). An application is uniquely identified by an `appId`.

post.description: Create a new [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).
Update data for an existing [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.

get.description: Get details for an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`.

delete.description: Delete an [application](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application) using `appId`. Your organization will lose access to this application.

post.description: Builds a game server artifact from a tarball you provide. Pass in the `buildId` generated from [`CreateBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/CreateBuild).
Builds a game server artifact from a tarball you provide. Pass in the `buildId` generated from [`CreateBuild()`](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/BuildV1/operation/CreateBuild).

tags.name: AppV1
tags.description: Operations that allow you manage your [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application).

tags.name: AuthV1
tags.description: Operations that allow you to generate a Hathora-signed [JSON web token (JWT)](https://jwt.io/) for [player authentication](https://hathora.dev/docs/lobbies-and-matchmaking/auth-service).

tags.name: BuildV2
tags.description: Operations that allow you create and manage your [builds](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build).

tags.name: DeploymentV2
tags.description: Operations that allow you configure and manage an application's [build](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#build) at runtime.

tags.name: DiscoveryV2
tags.description: Service that allows clients to directly ping all Hathora regions to get latency information

tags.name: DiscoveryV1
tags.description: Deprecated. Does not include latest Regions (missing Dallas region). Use [DiscoveryV2](https://hathora.dev/api#tag/DiscoveryV2).

tags.name: LobbyV3
tags.description: Operations to create and manage lobbies using our [Lobby Service](https://hathora.dev/docs/lobbies-and-matchmaking/lobby-service).

tags.name: LogV1
tags.description: Operations to get logs by [applications](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#application), [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process), and [deployments](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#deployment). We store 20GB of logs data.

tags.name: MetricsV1
tags.description: Operations to get metrics by [process](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process). We store 72 hours of metrics data.

tags.name: ProcessesV2
tags.description: Operations to get data on active and stopped [processes](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#process).

tags.name: RoomV2
tags.description: Operations to create, manage, and connect to [rooms](https://hathora.dev/docs/concepts/hathora-entities#room).
